segments.text: The room fills with the sound of running water, drowning out everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman wiping the plate, her movements methodical and calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But it’s alarming how she remains oblivious to the rising water around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s precarious position on that stool makes my stomach drop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel disgusted at how careless it all seems, this disregard for safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister looks so eager, her hand reaching up for a treat, and yet I feel sad for her innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Can’t she see how dangerous this is? Or is her trust in her brother blinding her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could intervene, to shake the woman out of her trance and alert her to the chaos unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a bittersweet irony in this moment; mundane life filled with little disasters ready to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at their mischief, even if it leaves me holding my breath.
segments.speaker: PAR
